nodes.text: Lady Leyli was a Selonian female official and aide to the Queen of Tralus on Tralus during the Galactic Civil War. Shortly after the Battle of Endor, she informed the Rebel Alliance's Rogue Squadron of the location of a Galactic Empire base on the planet, where General Weir was torturing their comrade, Ten Numb.

During the Galactic Civil War, Lady Leyli was the aide to the Queen of Tralus. A week after the Battle of Endor of 4 ABY, the Galactic Empire's General Weir attacked the Core Worlds planet of Corellia and abducted Rebel pilot Ten Numb, bringing him to a base near the city in which Leyli resided for interrogation. The Rebel Alliance's Rogue Squadron traveled to the nearby planet of Tralus in hot pursuit of Weir; upon landing on Tralus and encountering the Selonian community there, the pilots of Rogue Squadron met with Leyli. She expressed her fear of the Sith Lord Darth Vader and Galactic Emperor Palpatine; initially doubting Jedi Knight Luke Skywalker's reports of Vader's death and the Empire's defeat at Endor, she was convinced by his assurances.

Leyli decided to keep her queen uninformed of the situation until the Rebels had defeated Weir. Leyli enlisted several Selonian scouts to lead Skywalker and Rogue Squadron leader Wedge Antilles to Weir's base, where the general was holding Numb. Leyli added that Weir was notoriously cruel, and that their comrade would surely be wishing for death by that time. Numb would later be found dead by Rogue Wes Janson.

Leyli was a cautious and pragmatic individual; concerned with the protection of her community and queen on Tralus, those tendencies were motivated by fear of Darth Vader and Palpatine. Despite her unease, she offered help to the heroes of the Rebellion and assisted in directing them to Weir's hidden nerve center. A Selonian female with brown fur and green eyes framed in slightly paler fur, Leyli stood at a considerably taller height than Luke Skywalker, who stood at 1.72 meters.
Around the time of her encounter with Rogue Squadron, Leyli wore a white dress with a long, high-necked blue cape flowing behind her and a golden tiara fitted with a green jewel atop her head.
Leyli appeared in X-Wing: Rogue Leader 3, the third installment of the X-Wing: Rogue Leader comic arc written by W. Haden Blackman and illustrated by Tomás Giorello and released on November 23, 2005.
